importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the news article, indicating when the incident and the subsequent public response occurred.
The date of Doug Martin's NFL draft selection, highlighting a key milestone in his career and establishing his prominence in professional football.
The year in which Martin achieved significant rushing stats and earned first-team All-Pro honors, showcasing his peak performance and recognition in the NFL.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The period during which Doug Martin achieved major career milestones, including draft selection, Pro Bowl appearances, and All-Pro honors, illustrating his professional impact.

keyTakeAways: Former NFL running back Doug Martin died after a brief struggle with police during a break-in investigation in Oakland.
Martin was a 31st overall pick in the 2012 NFL draft and had a standout career with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, including 5,356 rushing yards and 30 touchdowns.
He was named first-team All-Pro and made the Pro Bowl twice, and was recognized as one of the top 50 players in Buccaneers history.
The incident occurred on a Saturday morning when officers attempted to detain him, and he became unresponsive, leading to his death in a hospital.
An autopsy will be conducted to determine the cause of death, and the Oakland Police Department confirmed a brief struggle occurred during the arrest.
The Oakland Mayor and Tampa Bay Buccaneers publicly expressed condolences, highlighting Martin’s legacy and connection to the community.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Former NFL running back Doug Martin, a 31st overall pick in the 2012 NFL draft and a standout player for the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, died after a brief struggle with Oakland Police officers during a break-in investigation at a home in Oakland. He became unresponsive during the arrest and later succumbed to his injuries in a hospital. The Oakland Police Department confirmed a struggle occurred, though no further details were released. The incident has sparked public concern over police use of force and the treatment of individuals during detentions. The Tampa Bay Buccaneers and Oakland Mayor Barbara Lee expressed deep sorrow, affirming Martin’s legacy as a celebrated athlete and community member. An autopsy is scheduled to determine the cause of death, and the family has requested privacy during their mourning.
title: Former NFL Player Doug Martin Dies After Police Detention During Break-In Investigation
